headline: Creamy Blueberry Pie
description: A sweet, custardy sour cream mixture is spooned over fresh blueberries, topped with a sweet buttery crumble, and baked. If desired, garnish with mint sprigs and additional blueberries.

video.description: See how to make a simple, sweet, custardy berry pie.
video.name: Creamy Blueberry Pie

name: Creamy Blueberry Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the blueberries in the pastry shell and set aside.
Combine 1 cup sugar, 1/3 cup flour, and salt. Add eggs and sour cream, stirring until blended. Pour the sour cream custard over the blueberries.

In another bowl, combine 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 cup flour. Cut in the butter with pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle the topping over the sour cream mixture and berries in the pie shell.
Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 55 minutes, or until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack.

review.reviewBody: I was excited to try this after reading a lot of the reviews. I made only a couple changes: I made my own crust, I decreased the sugar to 3/4 cup, I added some vanilla and sour cream to the custard, and I used brown sugar on the crumble topping. Honestly, I have never made or even tasted a Blueberry Pie before this but I thought it was going to be better. It was good but not OUTSTANDING, which is what I was hoping for. I will move on to other blueberry recipes until I find the best.
I haven't actually tried it yet. Waiting for my husband to get home and cut it first. Since I made it for him. But all recipes has never disappointed me!
Absolutely delicious. I gave to my kids and they loved it! Definitely a keeper
Made it and loved it!
This pie was just ok. The topping was gritty from the granulated sugar. The custard was just ok.
My go to pie!! Absolutely perfect!
Swapped whole milk Greek yogurt for sour cream, and folded some oats into the streusel. Will make this again!

Wow wow, this was super simple and absolutely worth the wait for it to cool down after coming out of the oven. I used hand picked Bog blueberries (Alaska) which are more on the tangy sour side than sweet like your typically grocery berries. My first bit could figure out what was happening with all the explosive fathers going on. The sweetness of the creek filling and the sour of my berries had my tongue in a massive debate. The. The crispy crumble topping that was so perfectly crunchy just pulled the whole thing together. Wow, wow! Huge winner and definitely adding to my family recipe book with a few minor changes to fit family preferences.
I used 1/2 the sugar, yum!
One word…..DELICIOUS! I will share this recipe and make again!

Hey! All of you blueberry lovers!!! This is one of the best blueberry pie recipes I have tried in years. It is super simple to make. The blueberry flavor is absolutely fabulous. I used fresh blueberries when making this pie. It's like the blueberry is floating in a creamy consistency. Then BAM! Hello blueberry!!! Genius! The topping on this gets a 4-star, as well. Kudos to the creator of this recipe! I will definitely make this again!
I dream about this pie! it's absolutely delicious!
I love everything about this recipe. I added peaches as well and it was delicious!! It has been a hit every time I make it!

Oh my! This may get me to rock-star status among my peers. After reading many reviews, I did add some vanilla and subbed light brown sugar in the streusel. It was still warm and set up nicely after an hour of cooling. That was as long as we could stand to wait before digging in! Thanks, Susan!

I followed this recipe exactly as written except I used 3 cups Wild Maine Frozen Blueberries that I had on hand. Wowwwweeee! This is EASY- Elegant- totally amazing. I would have taken a photo but it was all gone too quickly!

This is a great recipe! I have used the recipe several times for blueberry pie and have replaced the blueberries with chopped rhubarb, red raspberries, diced nectarines and chopped chopped apples. With the apples I added cinnamon in the filling and topping, in the nectarine pie I added almond extract in the filling and sliced almonds in the topping and lately because there are only two of us I’ve cut the recipe in half to make a six inch pie,it works perfectly. I also add lemon zest to my blueberry pies now it makes the blueberry flavor stand out more.
Amazing and easy. I used plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. Increased the ingredients by a third to make it a bigger pie.
Easy to make, delicious without being super sweet.

I have made this particular recipe on numerous occasions. it usually turns out very well, and there are usually no leftovers. I use half the amount of sugar in the custard base, and I use three quarters of the sugar in the buttery crust. Do not use fully frozen blueberries or use too much sour cream in the custard sauce. This will cause your pie to have a soupy texture. I use two and two thirds cups of blueberries per pie. I have found that using three in the pre-made pie shells that I use tends to overfill them. This last time placed crushed walnuts on top of the pie after I had sprinkled the buttery topping. it turned out phenomenally well. perhaps some of these suggestions May help you but I definitely would recommend cutting back on the sugar as it does not usually dissolve properly in the mix
I have made this several times. (I also like it with a graham cracker crust.). It looks like you can use this same technique with apples or peaches, although I haven’t tried it yet.
This pie was delicious! I made it using 1.5 cups of blueberries and 1.5 cups of strawberries and it turned out so good!
This recipe is fantastic. I have made this many times and it's a family favorite.
I did and it was delicious

I have made this recipe several times with different fruit blueberries alone blueberries with peaches blueberries with apples. The creamy filling I have used sour cream and combos of sour cream with yogurt. This is a very simple recipe and delicious every time. Thank you?
This pie was delicious. I used brown sugar for the topping, rather than white sugar. It was a hit with everyone. I will definitely make this again.
I will never make a blueberry pie any other way. It turned out GREAT.
Amazing all my fam loved it. Made with graham cracker crust and some cinnamon!
Delicious! First time making it, and had two requests for the recipe!! This will be my go to blueberry pie recipe!!
Easy to make and great for a summer evening dessert! Everyone commented on how light and tasty this was. Thank you!
Easy and Delicious. I used 1/2 cup maple syrup instead of white sugar in the custard and added 2 extra Tbls of flour to compensate for the extra liquid in the maple syrup.

Love this recipe and soooo did my guests! I increased the blueberries about 3/4 of a cup. For the topping all I had was dark br. sugar so I mixed 1/2 white and 1/2 dark. I used the "Best Ever Pie Crust" from this website as well. I'm not a fan of store bought crusts. It was beautiful.
Amazing with the fresh blue berries
I made this as written and it was excellent. Don’t change a thing.
So simple to make, so hard to resist eating in one sitting. Great introductory pie with great results. Don’t miss making this delicious pie!

This is very good & super easy. Based on personal taste & other reviews I reduced the sugar in the filling to 3/4 C, added vanilla to the custard & increased the sour cream to 2/3 C & am glad I did. ** Don't make the mistake I did though by adding another cup of blueberries (I like thick pie). The blueberries are now all over the bottom of my oven. I however am a traditionalist I guess. I like "regular" blueberry pie better. but will make this again because it's good & so much easier plus the son likes it better & the hub likes it equally ( I made a traditional blueberry pie last week).
TOOOOO SWEEET. I will reduce the sugar next time and maybe substitute sugar in the crust cover for Oat.
HOLY DELICIOUS!!!! Try stopping at 1 piece...can't be done!! Be sure to use fresh blueberries, brown sugar for topping and 1tsp vanilla in the custard.

I’ve made several recipes from this site but this is the first one I’m reviewing. It’s amazing. I followed the recipe exactly. I did have to substitute 1 1/2 cups of mixed frozen berries (raspberries, strawberries, blackberries, blueberries) in because I didn’t have enough fresh blueberries. I just put them in a colander to thaw while I got it made. SO GOOD and SO EASY. Not creamy though. I can’t describe it. It’s just amazing.

I love this recipe! The only change I make on occasion is sub out lemon yogurt for the sour cream. Also if I am using frozen blueberries because it is out of season, I add about another tablespoon of flour in case the frozen berries hold more liquid. Fresh is best though!

I love this recipe! The only change I make on occasion is sub out lemon yogurt for the sour cream. Also if I am using frozen blueberries because it is out of season, I add about another tablespoon of flour in case the frozen berries hold more liquid. Fresh is best though!

This is my go-to recipe for all my pies, haskap berries, saskatoon berries, rhubarb, you name the berry and this is the recipe I use. I don't get a sloppy pie but one that when you cut into it and lift out the slices, it's a beautiful thing. The only tweak that I've done with this recipe is increase the berries from 3 cups to 4 or 5 cups depending on what berry I use and the size and depth of my pie plate. I tend to keep the amount of sugar to what the recipe calls for. Best pie recipe on the web!
It was very easy to make and tastes delicious!

Love Love Love this recipe, I subbed crushed almonds for 1/2 of flour for "topping" wanted it crunchier. I used 4 small peaches, "flesh only", 1 1/2 cups blueberries & 1/2 cup raspberries. It's a great fruity pie, after adjusting sugar to taste for filling.

I made two mistakes. Put the eggs in the custard mix forgetting to beat them first. Then I forgot the sour cream and just spread it over the blueberries before adding the crumbles. It was wonderful anyway.
Excellent! Everyone loved it. I substituted Splenda for the sugar.

The vanilla in the custard really adds something and I also added some lemon zest. For the topping, I added 1/2 cup rolled oats and a half teaspoon of cinnamon. Yummy! Everyone said best blueberry pie ever.

I made a bunch of changes, but started with this recipe that is a game changer. Probably I’ll add the new concoction as a separate recipe, eventually.

First made a blueberry pie filling, simmered 1-1/2 containers of blueberries with 1/4c water, 1/4c cherry juice, 1/2t vanilla, 1/3c white sugar, 1T cornstarch.

Didn’t have enough blueberries, so greased a 5x8 pan.
Didn’t have a pie crust so made double the crumble (half white sugar, half brown sugar, lots of butter) and used half as the bottom crust. Baked the bottom crust for 10 minutes at 400. 
Added 1t cinnamon to the custard and cut the sugar in half.
Layered the crumble over the custard over the blueberry filling and baked for 25 minutes.
So. Amazingly. Wonderful. (with vanilla ice cream)
This is so Scrumptious!! I could hardly leave my hands off of it!

First I will say that thi is a super easy pie to make. I ended up using some frozen blueberries we had that I wanted to use up. I will agree with some of the other comments about it being a tad too sweet. I'd personally cut back the sugar in the crumble topping to about 1/3 cup instead of 1/2. Then substitute some oats or maybe chopped nuts. The other thing I did was add a bit of cinnamon and nutmeg to the topping and then some cinnamon and vanilla to the custard itself. The only "spice" in the original recipe is salt. Lastly....Would I make this again? Yes I probably would. It's unique enough and a bit out of the ordinary so I king of like that.

I made this today....flavour is great. I used less sugar then suggested and I also made it with mixed berries as I had a bunch on hand. I will make it again, but I will use brown sugar for the Streusel.
It was outstanding!! I used 3/4 C sugar, added 4 oz cream cheese and for the streusel used all brown sugar. Can’t wait to make it again!
Followed this recipe completely and made a strawberry pie and a blackberry pie. They were both delish. Highly recommend this easy yet wonderful recipe.

This was a really good recipe! Friends of mine asked for more. Being unfamiliar with pie creations, I just picked this one off of previous reviews. I used exactly what the recipe called for, no substitutions other than the fact I used fresh picked blackberries instead of blueberries. When I made it the second time, I added cinnamon just because and brown sugar to the crumble. I don't own a pastry blender so I melted the butter into the flour and sugar for the crumbled topping. Great recipe!
The best pie you could imagine.

I made this today and it is really good. I didn't want to use a crust to save a few calories and I made the topping with brown sugar and about half quick cooking oatmeal. otherwise I followed the recipe. my husband really liked it too.

I am a baker at an assisted living facility. I tried these pies recently and our residents loved them. I even made some sugar free pies. It was easy, fast and very delicious. I always read reviews and usually consider any changes if they are consistently recommended.
I will definitely make this again. Brought it to a family dinner and the sounds of 'mmmmm' as people put bites in their mouths continued through many bites. Excellent & easy recipe.
Easy and delicious!
Made no changes, was delicious, will certainly make it again.
Beautiful pie, super easy to make. Waiting for it to cool to try a slice!

Absolutely blueberrylicious!! Super easy and quick to make, was a hit with my guests. Very few ingredients and whipped it up in 15 minutes. I used about 3 cups of blueberries (simply because I didn’t want leftover berries-using 2 cups would’ve been fine) and increased the other ingredients slightly—this recipe is impossible to mess up. It took longer than advertised to bake probably because of the increased berries, but it was worth it. It’s now a must-do favorite for all our guest visits.
FANTASTIC! Made per direction's except added a little cinnamon. Will reduce sugar when I make again (soon).

I made this with my granddaughter for Thanksgiving. It is surprising easy and very tasty. We made a few additions like a sprinkle of brown sugar and nutmeg on the top. My oven is slow so we cooked it a little longer. It set very well and is not too sweet. This is a keeper!
graham cracker crust and added raspberries. we'll see how it comes out with ice cream and whipped cream.
Delicious! Would make it again. I used blueberries that had been in the freezer since last season, and it still came out great.

drain the berries if frozen, only 3/4 cup sugar in custard
cut crumble in half, and use brown sugar
Delicious. I got rave reviews. Will definitely make it again.

This has to be the best blueberry pie I’ve ever had! I followed the recipe exactly with the exception of adding a teaspoon of vanilla to the custard and I sprinkled cinnamon and nutmeg on the blueberries. My family inhaled it and they are begging for more. Delicious!

First time I followed other reviewers' suggestions to add vanilla to custard and cinnamon to crumble and change half the white sugar to brown sugar. Those suggestions were all good. However, I also reduced the total amount of sugar based on some reviews, but this was a mistake. To me the custard did not balance with the topping. So, second time I still used other suggestions even added a tad more vanilla, but I did not reduce the amount of sugar. In fact, I used 1/3cup white, 1/3 cup brown and 1/3 cup Splenda and it was perfect. I gave 4 stars even though we loved it because I do not believe it would be as good without the addition of vanilla, cinnamon and brown sugar.

Update: I have now made this pie 4 times in the past month... my family LOVES it.

This is the only blueberry pie I make. This time I used fat free yogurt instead of sour cream. I can’t remember what it tasted like with the sour cream so I hesitate to say it was exactly the same but I can say that it was still delicious. I love the crumb topping. An excellent pie!

An easy pie to make. I just didn't feel fruity enough. I would add more blueberries if I were to make again. I also decreased the sugar in the filling to 2/3 cups, and it was still plenty sweet. As recommended by other reviews, for the topping I used 1/2 flour and 1/2 oatmeal and brown sugar. I like very much liked the toping this way.
So easy and our family's very favorite pie! I make it multiple times a year when blueberries are on sale. It sets up beautifully. Be sure to cook completely before slicing. I prefer it chilled.

This pie was good, but too sweet for my taste. Maybe it was the streusel topping? Next time I’d go with 1/2 to 3/4 cups sugar in the custard, depending on the sweetness of your berries. Mine weren’t very sweet, but 1 cup of sugar was overwhelming.
I didn’t go with my instincts & made the streusel as directed with white sugar... Definitely go for brown! And add a splash of vanilla or almond extract to the custard as well.
Note: the topping gets soggy after a day, so make sure to eat it sooner than later. 
Best part of the pie was the crust! Ruth's Grandma's Pie Crust recipe from this site. :)

I made this because I had so many blueberries I didn't know what to do with them!......this has incredible flavour unlike I've ever had in a pie! it has to be the sour cream. so incredibly simple to make too! huge hit in my house!

Excellent! I don't like the idea of my blueberries being on the bottom of the pie and the custard on top so I was tempted to stir the blueberries in with the custard before pouring into the deep dish. I decided to follow the recipe to the letter and am very happy I did. There were plenty of blueberries bubbling to the top when I pulled it out of the oven. 

Our guests, who have dined with us many times, implored us for the recipe - a first! The woman, who would usually bring a dessert to our dinner parties, said she was going to stick to bringing appetizers as she didn't want to compete with anybody who could make desserts this tasty.

This recipe is easy and produces spectacular results. FWIW, I used fresh blueberries from our garden.
Delicious recipe! Would make it again and wouldn't change a thing!

This pie is awesome. Easy to make and could not be more delicious. Family favorite the first time I served it. Made it as written, using the Easy Pie Crust recipe from Natasha's Kitchen: https://natashaskitchen.com/easy-pie-crust-recipe/
This is a must make. I did change to brown sugar for topping & added vanilla to custard.
This was easy and delicious! I agree a bit less sugar would’ve been ok, but this pie is fantastic just as the recipe is.
This is my favorite blueberry pie recipe. I use a graham cracker crust because I am lazy and I prefer them to other store bought crusts.

This was one of the better blueberrie pies I’ve made and it drew rave reviews! I loved it. My family loved it! I can’t wait to use fresh berries this summer as mine were frozen. Still an awesome recipe I will use again. 
I mistakenly used twice the butter in the topping so I added extra flour and no one seamed to mind!
Easy directions ingredients came together quickly , I added vanilla to the batter and used brown sugar in the crumbled topping - tomorrow will be the taste test .

Very easy and everyone liked it. I did as others suggested and used only 3/4 cup sugar and it was just right. I cut the streusel amount in half and still had some left over. I’ll definitely make it again.
An excellent pie! Family enjoyed it immensely... I am planning to try it with less sugar next time and we'll see how that goes.
This is an amazing recipe! I followed the instruction except used frozen blueberry's from our garden and the pie came out perfect. Thank you....
never fails to please and so easy!

This was exceptional. I lost power halfway through baking and it still came out excellent. I added a pinch of cinnamon to the topping, but that was the only change I made. If you have an abundance of blueberries, try this. You won't be disappointed.

I’ve tried 3 blueberry recipes this summer and this is my favorite. I think the portion of the crumb topping is just right. It looks like too much at first but after baking, it’s the correct proportion for the pie. I will cut back on some of the sugar in the filling next time.
I thought this was pretty good, but my family did not order it. They thought that it was too runny.

This is my new favorite pie, we all love it! I did tweak it a little bit... I added cinnamon to the custard mixture. I read other reviews that said there was too much topping but I decided to go ahead and pile it on top anyway, thinking the whole time that it was way too much. Boy, am I glad I did because it was awesome. Everything kind of compressed down and it was delicious! I've made it four times now and it is perfect. we often eat it cold out of the fridge for breakfast.
I make this pie every year for my boyfriend's birthday. Someone in the comments changed the recipe slightly and I've been using that one for the past couple years.
This recipe is awesome! Will consider decreasing the sugar next time but it was sooo good.
Great pie. It enhanced the blueberries and intensified their flavor instead of covering them up with sugar.

It was amazing.
I gave it a few minutes under the broiler to really golden it up .

I was disappointed in this pie. I did make a few changes after reading the recipe and thinking that it had a large amount of sugar. Then I read some of the reviews where they were cutting the amount of sugar so I followed suit and used 3/4C. in the custard. I also used 1tsp. of vanilla extract. The streusel I used 1/4 white and 1/4 brown sugar. If I ever made this again I would use just brown sugar. The pie just didn't have enough flavor and I am going to throw the rest of it in the garbage. Very sad.
Outstanding...family favorite.
Did this with 1 cup blueberries, 1 cup strawberries, and 1 cup blackberries and it was sooooo good!
Did this with 1 cup blueberries, 1 cup strawberries, and 1 cup blackberries and it was sooooo good!

For the top crumbs the recipe on here says to use white sugar. I tried making it for 30 minutes adding more sugar & flour wondering why how it kept coming out as a doughy mixture. Watched the video & realized the recipe is wrong & they use brown sugar not regular sugar.
